documents.description: The organization has a defined governance structure with clear roles and responsibilities.

subStandards.description: A governing body is established with clear authority and responsibility for the organization.
The governing body defines the mission, vision, and strategic objectives of the organization.
The governing body provides oversight of the organization's performance and quality improvements.
Clear organizational structure and reporting lines are documented.
The organization ensures ethical and transparent governance practices.

documents.description: The organization establishes policies and procedures for quality management.

subStandards.description: A quality policy is established and communicated to all staff.
The organization has a structured approach to quality improvement and patient safety.
Leadership is committed to continuous improvement and resource allocation.
Performance indicators are monitored and evaluated regularly.

documents.description: The organization has effective human resource management policies and procedures.

subStandards.description: The organization has a human resources plan aligned with organizational objectives.
Staff recruitment and selection processes ensure qualification and competence.
The organization provides orientation and training programs for new staff.
Performance evaluation and appraisal systems are implemented.
Continuing professional development is supported and monitored.
Competence is assessed and maintained through regular evaluation.

documents.description: The organization ensures adequate staffing and working conditions.

subStandards.description: Staffing levels are adequate to meet organizational needs and patient safety.
Working conditions are safe and support staff health and well-being.
Staff records and credentials are maintained accurately and securely.
Occupational health and safety programs are implemented and monitored.

documents.description: Patient identification and safety is ensured throughout care delivery.

subStandards.description: At least two patient identifiers are used when providing care, treatment, and services.
Specimens and specimens containers are labeled in the patient's presence.
Patient wristbands or identification systems are used in inpatient settings.
Verification of patient identity is performed before procedures, medication, or treatment.
Staff are trained on proper patient identification protocols.

documents.description: Effective communication is implemented to ensure patient safety.

subStandards.description: A standardized process for hand-off communication between healthcare professionals is implemented.
Critical information is communicated accurately and completely.
Communication barriers are addressed to ensure clarity and understanding.
Staff are trained on effective communication techniques.
Feedback mechanisms are in place to verify understanding of communicated information.

documents.description: Medication safety is ensured through proper management and administration.

subStandards.description: A list of abbreviations, symbols, and dose expressions that are prohibited is established.
Medication reconciliation is performed at care transitions.
Medications are stored securely and properly labeled.
Right patient, right medication, right dose, right route, and right time are verified before administration.
Adverse drug events are reported and investigated.
Staff are trained on medication safety protocols.
High-risk medications are identified and special precautions are taken.
Medication errors are tracked and analyzed for system improvement.

documents.description: Infection prevention and control measures are implemented to reduce healthcare-associated infections.

subStandards.description: Hand hygiene practices are implemented and monitored in all areas.
Personal protective equipment is available and properly used.
Sterilization and disinfection procedures are implemented for instruments and equipment.
Standard precautions are followed in all patient care settings.
Isolation precautions are implemented for patients with communicable diseases.
Infection rates are monitored and improvement initiatives are implemented.

documents.description: Surgical safety measures are implemented to prevent adverse events.

subStandards.description: A pre-operative assessment and evaluation process is implemented.
A surgical safety checklist is used before, during, and after surgery.
Site marking and verification procedures prevent wrong-site, wrong-patient, wrong-procedure surgery.
Anesthesia safety measures are implemented and monitored.
Surgical counts of instruments and sponges are performed and documented.
Surgical complications and adverse events are reported and investigated.

documents.description: The organization provides specialized medical care services based on its scope of services.

subStandards.description: The scope of specialized medical services is clearly defined and documented.
Services are delivered by qualified and competent healthcare professionals.
Clinical guidelines and protocols are in place for each specialized service.
Quality and safety measures are implemented for specialized services.

documents.description: Emergency care services are organized and accessible.

subStandards.description: Emergency departments operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
Triage system is implemented to prioritize patient care.
Emergency protocols and resuscitation equipment are available.
Staff are trained in emergency management and life support.
Waiting times are monitored and managed appropriately.

documents.description: The organization has a comprehensive quality management system.

subStandards.description: A quality management system is established with clear objectives and goals.
Quality indicators are defined and monitored regularly.
Continuous improvement processes are implemented throughout the organization.
Data and analysis support decision-making for quality improvement.
All staff are engaged in quality improvement initiatives.

documents.description: Risk management processes are implemented to identify and mitigate risks.

subStandards.description: A risk management program is established with clear responsibilities.
Risks are identified, analyzed, and assessed systematically.
Risk mitigation strategies are developed and implemented.
Adverse events and near-misses are reported and investigated.
Corrective actions are implemented and their effectiveness is monitored.
Staff are trained on risk management and patient safety.

documents.description: Infection prevention and control program is established and managed.

subStandards.description: An infection prevention and control committee is established.
Infection prevention policies and procedures are documented and implemented.
Environmental and equipment hygiene measures are implemented.
Waste management and disposal procedures are implemented.
Healthcare-associated infection rates are monitored and reported.

documents.description: Medications are properly managed from procurement to administration.

subStandards.description: Medication procurement processes ensure quality and safety.
Medications are stored in appropriate conditions and locations.
Medication expiry dates are checked and expired medications are disposed of safely.
Pharmacy staff are qualified and competent.
A formulary is maintained and regularly reviewed.
Drug interactions and contraindications are monitored.

documents.description: Patient rights are respected and protected throughout the organization.

subStandards.description: Patients are informed of their rights and responsibilities upon admission.
Patient consent is obtained for treatments and procedures.
Patient privacy and confidentiality are maintained.
Patients have access to their medical records.
A process for handling patient complaints and grievances is in place.

documents.description: Patients receive education to promote health and well-being.

subStandards.description: Patient education programs are provided on treatment, medications, and self-care.
Health promotion information is available to patients and families.
Education is provided in a language and format that patients understand.
Discharge instructions are provided to patients.

documents.description: The organization has a comprehensive information management system.

subStandards.description: Information technology systems are in place to support patient care and operations.
Data security and privacy measures are implemented.
Electronic health records are maintained for all patients.
Data backup and disaster recovery plans are in place.
Staff are trained on information system use and data security.

documents.description: Patient records are accurate, complete, and accessible.

subStandards.description: Patient records are initiated promptly upon admission.
Records are legible and contain required information.
Entries are dated, timed, and signed by the responsible provider.
Records are retained according to legal and organizational requirements.
Access to records is controlled and logged.

documents.description: The organization provides a safe, clean, and functional physical environment.

subStandards.description: Facilities are designed and maintained to ensure patient safety and comfort.
Utilities and medical gas systems are maintained and monitored.
Fire safety, emergency preparedness, and evacuation plans are in place.
Equipment is maintained, inspected, and serviced regularly.
Housekeeping and environmental hygiene standards are implemented.
Hazardous materials are managed safely.

documents.description: The organization manages occupational health and safety.

subStandards.description: Workplace hazards are identified and controlled.
Personal protective equipment is provided and used appropriately.
Occupational health services are available to staff.
Incident reporting and investigation procedures are in place.
Staff training on occupational health and safety is provided.
